Department of Business Intelligence, Humanities and Governance
==============================================================

The Department of Business Intelligence, Humanities, and Governance (BIHG) at the Faculty of Artificial Intelligence is at the forefront of interdisciplinary studies bridging technology and governance to ensure human values. With a focus on business intelligence, the department explores innovative applications of AI in various industries, optimizing decision-making processes, information security assurance technology and enhancing efficiency. Information security assurance is a key pillar, addressing the challenges of data privacy, cybersecurity, and risk management in an increasing digital world. Moreover, by specializing in AI governance, BIHG examines the ethical, legal, and social implications of AI, ensuring its responsible and equitable use in society. BIHG integrates humanities perspectives, emphasizing the importance of cultural understanding, diversity, and inclusivity in AI development and deployment. Through research, education, and collaboration, BIHG aims to shape the future of AI by fostering a balance between technological advancement and human well-being, thereby contributing to a more sustainable and ethical AI-driven world.

##### Niche Area

**AI In Governance and Policy | Responsible AI and Ethics | AI in Financial | Future Technoprenuership and Innovation |Consumer Behaviour Analysis | Social Media Insight | AI in Talent Development | Precision Marketing | Market Prediction | Trust, Risk and Security in AI Models (Trism) | AI in Business**
